result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn Edward Morris

defendant.name: Morris, Shawn Edward

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shawn Edward Morris in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Shawn Edward Morris.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-10-2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report - 10-07-2022

Defendant Shawn Edward Morris not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Shawn Edward Morris.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Bail/bond hearing held. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shawn Edward Morris appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey appeared by video for Shawn Edward Morris.  Prosecuting attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Shawn Edward Morris
Current: 5565 North 33rd Street Apt. A, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 06-22-2022)
Prior: 5565 North 33rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a pre-trial conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court takes no action as to bail.

Court ordered no contact with K.M.G (10/21/2001)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Shawn Edward Morris in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Shawn Edward Morris in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
